text: Olga Valentinovna Korbut (born May 16, 1955 in Grodno, Belarus), also known as the "Sparrow from Minsk", is a retired Belarusian gymnast. She won four gold medals and two silver medals at the Summer Olympic Games, in which she competed in 1972 and 1976 for the Soviet team. She could do backwards flips from the balance beam and uneven parallel bars, when no one else could. "Olga Korbut." (2009). Notable Sports Figures. Detroit: Gale Publishing. p. 859. After her retirement from gymnastics, she became a teacher. == References == Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Olympic medalists for Belarus Category:Belarusian gymnasts Category:Medalists at the 1972 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1976 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic gold medalists for the Soviet Union Category:Olympic silver medalists for the Soviet Union Category:Soviet gymnasts Category:Teachers
title: Olga Korbut
